column2: Single European Sky: annual monitoring highlights persistent capacity shortages and failure to meet environmental targets in 2023, as traffic recovers
column3: The Performance Review Body (PRB) has published the 2023 Annual Monitoring Report and Traffic Light System - part of its yearly review of how Single European Sky (SES) Member States are performing.

column2: Commission seeks feedback on the Flight Emissions Label
column3: The Commission has launched a public consultation on the draft proposal establishing the EU Flight Emissions Label.

column2: Women in Rail 2024 Award to boost female talent for a sustainable and competitive rail industry
column3: The Commission together with Europe’s Rail Joint Undertaking and the EU Agency for Railways celebrated the Women in Rail 2024 Award.

column2: CEF Transport: €2.5 billion to boost resilience and safety across the EU transport network
column3: The 2024 CEF for Transport call for proposals makes €2.5 billion available for projects that will modernise transport infrastructure on the EU’s TEN-T network, and in Ukraine and Moldova.

column2: Rail market opening: competition leads to lower ticket prices, EU study finds
column3: A study released by the European Commission highlights the user benefits of competition in both passenger rail and rail freight services.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – August 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: European Mobility Week kicks off to promote shared public spaces for sustainable urban mobility and improved quality of life
column3: The European Mobility Week, an annual event promoting sustainable urban mobility with over 2,500 cities and towns participating in a week-long festival from 16 to 22 September.

column2: TEN-T Corridor Coordinators
column3: Nine European Coordinators have been designated today to help complete the trans-European transport network (TEN-T), a vast infrastructure network of railways, roads, and inland waterways connecting the European Union.

column2: Sustainable Transport Forum - new sub-groups on hydrogen infrastructure, zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles and public key infrastructure for e-mobility
column3: In the wake of the adoption of the new Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), the European Commission has set up three new sub-groups under the Sustainable Transport Forum (STF) expert group.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – July 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Commission enforces temporary restrictions on liquid screening at certain EU airports
column3: The Commission will temporarily enforce restrictions on liquid screening at EU airports utilising Explosive Detection Systems for Cabin Baggage (EDSCB).

column2: European Commission launches Ship Financing Portal to boost the maritime sector's green transition
column3: The Ship Financing Portal, designed to improve access to financing for the shipping sector and the wider maritime industry, is now online!

column2: July infringement package: key decisions
column3: July infringement package: key decisions

column2: FuelEU Maritime Regulation: Q&A on implementation
column3: As the maritime sector prepares for the FuelEU Maritime Regulation, a new Commission document answers key questions on its implementation.

column2: Commission publishes new guidelines for more clarity on air passenger rights
column3: While more citizens of the European Union are aware of their EU passenger rights than was the case five years ago, the majority do not consider that they have enough information, according to the results of a Eurobarometer survey released today.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – June 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: EU invests record €7 billion in sustainable, safe and smart transport infrastructure
column3: The Commission has selected 134 projects to receive over €7 billion in EU grants from the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF), the EU's programme for investment in transport infrastructure.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – May 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: EU and ICAO strengthen commitment to global aviation safety, security, and sustainability
column3: The EU and the ICAO have reaffirmed their commitment to enhancing global aviation safety, security, and sustainability during a meeting at ICAO Headquarters in Montreal on 26 June.

column2: New EU Transport Report: Current trends and issues
column3: The European Commission has released an overview of the latest developments in the EU transport sector, highlighting trends and issues for both the EU and individual Member States.

column2: Urban public transport – New set of recommendations adopted by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM)
column3: The Commission’s Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has adopted recommendations on complementing public transport with shared mobility, and on using the Social Climate Fund to support public transport.

column2: EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: EU-funded scanners increase capacity at Hungarian-Ukrainian border
column3: A new EU-funded mobile cargo scanner was delivered today to the border crossing point in Chop at the Hungarian-Ukrainian border, in a bid to improve the flow of trade across Ukraine’s borders. Valued at approximately €2.5 million, the donation is part of the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

column2: Europeans are generally positive towards e-mobility
column3: A large survey by the European Alternative Fuels Observatory (EAFO) in twelve EU Member States shows a positive attitude towards switching to battery-electric cars.

column2: EU and Ukraine update and extend Road Transport Agreement
column3: The EU and Ukraine decided today to prolong and update their current road transport Agreement. Implemented due to lost transport routes and export markets east of Ukraine caused by the Russian aggression, the agreement supports the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

column2: A sustainable and resilient transport network bringing Europe closer together
column3: The Commission welcomes the final adoption of the Regulation underpinning the trans-European transport network (TEN-T) by the European Parliament and the Council.

column2: European Union signs aviation agreement with the People's Republic of Bangladesh
column3: The European Union and Bangladesh have signed a Horizontal Aviation Agreement

column2: May infringements package: key decisions
column3: May infringements package: key decisions

column2: Two years of Solidarity Lanes have brought the EU, Ukraine and Moldova closer together
column3: Two years ago, in May 2022, the Commission, in collaboration with Ukraine and Moldova, created the Solidarity Lanes to help improve the EU–Ukraine–Moldova transport routes in response to Russia’s illegal full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: improving the Danube routes together
column3: Representatives of Moldova, Romania, Ukraine, the United States  and the European Commission gathered today in Chisinau, continuing their work together to improve trade routes through the Solidarity Lanes along the Danube corridor.

column2: EU supports improved Ukrainian–Moldovan border crossing cooperation as part of Solidarity Lanes
column3: Today the European Commission, together with Ukraine, Moldova, Romania and the US are inaugurating the renewed Ukrainian-Moldovan border crossing point in Reni, Ukraine, as part of the Solidarity Lanes initiative.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – April 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Commission adopts reasoned opinion in case brought by Italy against Austria on road transport
column3: The Commission today adopted a reasoned opinion in a procedure brought by Italy against Austria under Article 259 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union.

column2: Excellence in Road Safety Awards 2024: applications now open
column3: Today, the European Road Safety Charter, the largest civil platform dedicated to road safety and led by the European Commission, opened applications for the 2024 Excellence in Road Safety Awards.

column2: April infringement package: key decisions
column3: April infringement package: key decisions

column2: Urban Vehicle Access Regulations (UVARs) – recommendations by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility
column3: The Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has adopted its recommendations on Urban Vehicle Access Regulations .

column2: Commission and EU rail sector launch Women in Rail Award 2024
column3: The award, divided into three categories, aims to promote fairness, diversity, and equality, and to celebrate outstanding and inspiring women and their achievements in the rail sector.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – March 2024
column3: In the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, the EU, together with Ukraine and Moldova launched the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes in May 2022, establishing new transport routes to keep Ukraine’s imports and exports flowing via rail, road and inland waterways.

column2: Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation: Q&A on operating recharging infrastructure
column3: The Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), comes into force on 13 April 2024, supporting the transition towards more sustainable transport by setting obligatory targets for the rollout of recharging and refuelling transport infrastructure.

column2: EU boosts zero-emission mobility with over €424 million in funding for 42 projects
column3: The Commission is announcing the selection of 42 new projects deploying alternative fuels infrastructure that will receive over €424 million in EU support.

column2: Commission paves way for safe integration of ‘air taxis' and other innovative drone uses
column3: The Commission adopted a set of measures to address the unique safety challenges of new emerging air mobility concepts and services and ensure that their operations will be as safe as those in manned aviation.

column2: New interactive page showcases positive impact of CEF Transport
column3: As part of the activities linked to the tenth anniversary of the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Programme, CINEA launched a new interactive web-page to showcase the contribution of the CEF for Transport Programme to greening and decarbonising the transport sector.

column2: EU institutions commit to boost cycling across Europe
column3: The EU is taking another important step in reducing transport emissions by adopting the European Declaration on Cycling

column2: Participatory conference on labour market developments and labour shortages in the transport sector in the European Union
column3: The Commission organises a participatory conference to enable discussions with and between relevant stakeholders on labour market developments

column2: Call for applications for the selection of members of the European ITS Advisory Group
column3: The Commission’s Directorate-General for Mobility and Transport has launched a call for applications to select new members of the European ITS Advisory Group

column2: Commissioner Vălean kicks off the Connecting Europe Days
column3: The Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean, is participating in the four-day Connecting Europe Days taking place in Brussels from 2 to 5 April 2024

column2: EU and Moldova extend Road Transport Agreement until 31 December 2025
column3: The EU and Moldova decided today to extend the validity of their current road transport Agreement until 31 December 2025. The Agreement aims at helping Moldova access world markets by facilitating transit through EU countries and also further developing its links with the EU market.

column2: EU and Ukraine continue strengthening Solidarity Lanes and cooperation on connectivity, safety and sustainability of transport
column3: The third high-level meeting of the EU-Ukraine Transport Dialogue took place yesterday in Kyiv, focusing on efforts to keep Ukraine's exports and imports moving via the Solidarity Lanes, improving connectivity, safety and security as well as sustainability.

column2: Honours for Diversity and Inclusion in Maritime, 8 March 2024
column3: The Belgian EU Presidency hosted the 'Conference on the Wellbeing of Seafarers' on International Women’s Day, March 8, 2024, featuring the 'Honours for Diversity and Inclusion in Maritime' award ceremony.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – February 2024
column3: In the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, the EU, together with Ukraine and Moldova launched the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes in May 2022, establishing new transport routes to keep Ukraine’s imports and exports flowing via rail, road and inland waterways.

column2: Budapest and online platform Nudgd recognised for green mobility activities in the European urban mobility awards
column3: Budapest was awarded the European Mobility Week Award in a ceremony in Brussels last night, while online platform Nudgd won the Mobility Action award.

column2: Provisional agreement on better cross-border enforcement of road safety traffic rules
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached last night between the European Parliament and the Council on facilitating the enforcement of road traffic rules across borders.

column2: March infringements package: key decisions
column3: March infringements package: key decisions

column2: 2023 figures show stalling progress in reducing road fatalities in too many countries
column3: Road safety in the EU 2023: Around 20 400 people were killed in road crashes last year, a small 2% decrease on 2022.

column2: Save the date for the next edition of the EU Women in Rail Awards!
column3: This April, the European Commission, together with Europe’s Rail, the European Union Agency for Railways, CER, UNIFE and ALE will launch the next edition of the EU Women in Rail Awards.

column2: Commission proposes to prolong road transport agreements with Ukraine and Moldova and introduces updates to the agreement with Ukraine
column3: The proposals, sent to the Council today, include updates to the agreement with Ukraine to improve its practical implementation and enforcement while maintaining its objectives and scope.

column2: Commission makes €1bn available for recharging and refuelling points under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF)
column3: The Commission is launching a call for proposals under the Connecting Europe Facility – Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Facility (AFIF)

column2: Public workshop: adoption of new ITS Working Programme 2024-2028
column3: On 19 March 2024 the European Commission will organise a stakeholder workshop via videoconference to discuss the new Working Programme of the ITS Directive for the period 2024-2028.

column2: Recording available: Academic conference on future of EU mobility and transport
column3: On 21 February 2024, the European Commission organised an all-day academic conference on the state of play on EU transport policy and the challenges and priorities for the future of EU transport and mobility. In case you missed it, you can still watch the recording!

column2: Commission welcomes provisional agreement modernising ship inspections and oversight
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the European Parliament and the Council on updating the requirements for the Port State Control of vessels calling at EU ports, and on the flag State requirements for merchant vessels registered in EU Member States.

column2: Extraordinary G7 Transport Ministerial welcomes EU maritime operation to safeguard Red Sea maritime security
column3: G7 Transport Ministers expressed strong condemnation of the attacks carried out by the Houthis against commercial vessels and navy ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.

column2: Commission welcomes provisional agreement on tackling ship-source pollution to help make European seas cleaner
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement between the European Parliament and the Council on the amendment of Directive 2005/35/EC on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties for pollution offences.

column2: Commission welcomes provisional agreement modernising maritime accident investigations
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached today between the European Parliament and the Council on the investigation of maritime accidents, modernising a 2009 Directive.

column2: Focus on urban public transport – first set of recommendations adopted by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM)
column3: During its last plenary meeting on 16 January the Commission Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) adopted its first set of recommendations to the European Commission, primarily influenced by the recent work of the EGUM members on public transport and shared mobility.

column2: EU and Moldova launch high-level dialogue on transport
column3: In a bid to strengthen cooperation in the transport field, Commissioner Adina Vălean and Moldova’s Minister for Infrastructure and Regional Development Andrei Spînu today launched the EU-Moldova high-level dialogue on transport.

column2: Global Gateway: €10 billion commitment to invest in Trans Caspian Transport Corridor connecting Europe and Central Asia announced at Investors Forum
column3: Executive Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis announced that European and international financial institutions present at the Forum will commit €10 billion in support and investments towards sustainable transport connectivity in Central Asia.

column2: Commission proposes to modernise river information services in EU
column3: The Commission adopted a proposal to improve traffic management on the EU’s rivers and canals.

column2: New report comparing air traffic management performance in Europe and the United States published
column3: In the ongoing series of comparative reports between Europe and the US, the most recent update looks at operational as well as economic air traffic management (ATM) performance.

column2: STF: Call for applications for new sub-groups on hydrogen infrastructure, zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles and e-mobility Public Key Infrastructure
column3: Sustainable Transport Forum – new calls for applications

column2: Commission supports military mobility projects with €807 million
column3: The Commission will fund 38 additional military mobility projects to support the transport of troops and equipment along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

column2: New deadline for the call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF)
column3: Deadline for the call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF) extended.

column2: Save the date: Global TBO Symposium (4-6 June 2024)
column3: Towards global trajectory-based operations (TBO)

column2: European Commission workshop addresses key challenges in seafaring profession
column3: Decarbonisation, digitalisation, social security and wellbeing at sea were the key topics on the agenda of the workshop for the seafaring profession on 17 January.

column2: “Europe for Aviation” teams up for Airspace World 2024
column3: The “Europe for Aviation” partners, consisting of nine European aviation organisations working to promote the modernisation, sustainability, and resilience of a safe European aviation, will come together at Airspace World, from 19-21 March 2024 in Geneva, Switzerland.

column2: December Infringements package: key decisions
column3: December Infringements package: key decisions

column2: Provisional agreement on more sustainable and resilient trans-European transport network brings Europe closer together
column3: TEN-T Trilogue

column2: Joint Statement on Higher Airspace Operations (HAO)
column3: Joint Statement on Higher Airspace Operations (HAO) by the EU, the US, Canada, Japan, and the UK.

column2: Moldova receives additional funding to improve rail infrastructure and advance Solidarity Lanes
column3: The European Investment Bank has today signed a €41.2 million loan with Moldova, destined to improve internal transport connections as well as to provide long-term economic benefits to the wider region. This loan will be complemented by an EU grant of €12 million.

column2: Single European Sky: Performance Review Body publishes new reports prior to fourth reference period of performance and charging scheme (RP4)
column3: The Performance Review Body (PRB) of the Single European Sky has today published three reports on air navigation service costs.

column2: New website of the EU Urban Mobility Observatory
column3: New website of the EU Urban Mobility Observatory

column2: Call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF)
column3: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to selecting members for the DTLF other than Member States' authorities and other public entities.
